text: Human T-cell leukemia virus type 1 <extra_id_0> tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein abrogates <extra_id_0> interleukin-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> dependence in a mouse T-cell line .
Human T-cell leukemia virus type 1 ( HTLV-1 ) is the etiologic agent of adult T-cell leukemia .

<extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , the viral protein , is thought to be crucial in the development of the disease , since it transforms healthy T cells in vitro and induces tumors in transgenic animals .

We examined the effect of <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity on the growth of the <extra_id_0> interleukin-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) - dependent T-cell line CTLL-2 .

Stable expression of <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in CTLL-2 transformed cell growth from being <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> dependent to <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> independent .
<extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulated transcription through NF-kappaB and the cyclic AMP - responsive element - like sequence in the HTLV-1 promoter .

The finding of <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mutants segregating these two pathways suggested that the NF-kappaB pathway was essential for <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - independent growth of CTLL-2 cells while the CRE pathway was unnecessary .
However , both pathways were necessary for another transformation - related activity ( colony formation in soft agar ) of CTLL-2 / <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Our results show that <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has at least two distinct activities on T cells , and suggest that <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> plays a crucial role in <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - independent T-cell transformation induced by HTLV-1 , in addition to its well-known <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent cell transformation .
